description.p: The present invention relates to an intervertebral disk prosthesis, intended to substitute the fibrocartilaginous disks joining the vertebrae in the spinal column, particularly on the cervical spine.

Various types of prosthesis are known in the prior art. Some of these prostheses, either because they are made of compressible material or because they allow excessive movement of the different constituent parts of the prosthesis with respect to each other, may induce relatively easily the ejection of at least one part of the prosthesis outside the vertebrae, which is not desirable for the patient.
The patent application US 6,368,350 B1 discloses an Intervertebral Disc Prosthesis according to the preamble of claim 1.

The purpose of the present invention is to remedy some drawbacks of the prior art by proposing a simple intervertebral disk prosthesis which makes it possible to limit the movements of the different constituent parts of the prosthesis with respect to each other.
This purpose is achieved by an intervertebral disk prosthesis as defined in claim 1.
The dependent claims also define other advantageous features of the present invention.

Other features and advantages of the present invention will be seen more clearly upon reading the description below, with reference to the appended figures, wherein:
figures 1 a and 1 b respectively represent a bottom view and a perspective bottom view of the upper plate according to one embodiment,
figures 2a and 2b respectively represent a top view and a perspective top view of the lower plate according to one embodiment,
figures 3a and 3b respectively represent a top view and a perspective top view of the core according to one embodiment,
figures 4a and 4b respectively represent a perspective top view and a side view of the intervertebral disk prosthesis according to the embodiment of figures 1 a, 1 b, 2a, 2b, 3a and 3b,
figures 5a and 5b respectively represent a side view and a sectional view along the plane D-D of figure 5a of the intervertebral disk prosthesis according to a second embodiment,
figure 6a represents a side view of an intervertebral disk prosthesis,
figures 6b and 6d represent a sectional view along the plane A-A of figure 6a, the core having, respectively, a slight clearance and no clearance with respect to the lower plate,
figures 6c and 6e represent a sectional view along the plane B-B of figure 6b and 6d, respectively,
figures 7a and 8a respectively represent a top view and perspective bottom view of the lower plate according to two other embodiments,
figures 7b and 8b respectively represent a perspective side view and a perspective top view of the lower plate of figures 7a and 8a, respectively, wherein prosthesis anchoring means are inserted according to two different embodiments,
figure 9a represents a top view of the lower plate according to a fourth embodiment,
figure 9b represents a sectional view of the lower plate along the plane plan C-C of figure 9a,
figures 10a and 10b respectively represent a rear and side view of the upper plate according to another embodiment.

The intervertebral disk prosthesis according to the invention is constituted of an upper plate 1 which is articulated with respect to a lower plate 2 by means of a core 3, as can particularly be seen in figures 4a, 4b, 5a and 6a. One advantage of the prosthesis according to the invention is that it comprises simple parts which can be designed so that the prosthesis is fitted on the cervical spine.

The upper plate 1, particularly visible in figures 1 a and 1b, is slightly concave on at least part 10 of its lower surface, so as to fit with the slightly convex upper surface of the core 3. The upper surface of the core 3 is complementary to the concave part 10 of the upper plate 1, enabling movement between the upper plate 1 and the core 3.

In an alternative embodiment, part of the upper surface of the upper plate 1 is convex, as shown in figures 10a and 10b, in order to fit better onto the vertebra whereon the prosthesis is to be fitted, the bottom of the vertebrae being concave. In this case, the convex part of the upper plate 1 is located in the front part of the upper plate, as can particularly be seen in figure 10b.

The lower plate 2 is substantially plane. In effect, its lower surface does not need to be convex or concave since the top of the vertebrae is substantially flat. In the embodiment of figures 2a, 2b, 7a and 8a, the lower plate 2 comprises two pins 20 located opposite each other on two substantially parallel edges 21, 22 of the lower plate 2. Each pin 20 is curved towards the inside of the prosthesis and can thus enter recesses 30 located on the core 3. The core 3, particularly visible in figures 3a and 3b, comprises a substantially plane lower surface, provided to fit onto the lower plate 2. The core 3 is thin (for example 3 mm thick) for a cervical prosthesis or thicker (for example 15 mm) for a lumbar prosthesis.

In the embodiment of figures 3a, 3b, 4a and 4b, the dimensions of each recess 30 of the core 3 are slightly greater than those of each pin 20 of the lower plate 2 so as to limit the clearance of the core 3 with respect to the lower plate 2, both in translation along an axis substantially parallel with the lower plate 2, and in rotation around an axis substantially perpendicular to the lower plate 2. The movement between the upper plate 1 and the core 3, as well as the clearance of the core 3 with respect to the lower plate 2, thus enable the patient to move and, if required, compensate for prosthesis positioning defects. This clearance also offers the advantage of preventing premature wear due to the stress applied to the prosthesis.

In figures 5a and 5b, the dimensions of each recess 30 of the core 3 are substantially the same as those of each pin 20 of the lower plate 2, so as to prevent any clearance of the core 3 with respect to the lower plate 2, both in translation and rotation. In the latter case, the only movement of the prosthesis authorised is that of the upper plate 1 with respect to the core 3.

In the embodiment in figures 9a and 9b, one of the pins 20 is replaced by a lug equipped with a drilling 200. A tag 23 fixes on the lug by means of a dowel 24 entering the drilling 200. In an alternative embodiment, both pins are replaced by a lug whereon a tag 23 is fixed.

In the embodiment of figures 6a, 6b, 6c, 6d and 6e, the lower plate 2 does not comprise any pins 20 but two dowel pins 25 located in the vicinity of the centre of the lower plate 2. In this case, the core 3, by complementarity, does not comprise any recesses 30, but two wells 35 under its lower surface. The dimensions of the dowel pins 25 of the lower plate 2 and of the wells 35 of the core 3 are such that, in the alternative embodiment represented in figures 6b and 6c, a slight clearance in translation and rotation is permitted, and in the alternative embodiment represented in figures 6d and 6e, no clearance is permitted.

In another embodiment, not shown, the lower plate 2 comprises a rib on its upper surface and no pins 20 or dowel pins 25. The core 3, by complementarity, comprises a groove under its lower surface. The dimensions of the rib of the lower plate and the groove of the core are such that a slight clearance in translation and rotation is permitted.

In another embodiment not shown, the lower plate 2 comprises, instead of the pins 20, two walls, arranged opposite each other, in the vicinity of two substantially parallel edges 21, 22 of the lower plate, but further in the prosthesis than the pins 20. The core 3 comprises complementary recesses with respect to the walls. The dimensions of each recess of the core in this embodiment are slightly greater than those of each wall of the lower plate, so as to enable a slight clearance in translation and rotation.
In a further embodiment not shown, the female components are located on the lower plate and the male components on the core.

The intervertebral disk prosthesis according to the invention particularly makes it possible to correct lordosis defects and to add lordosis to the spine, for example the cervical spine. Therefore, the presence of an acute angle in the front-rear direction F, figure 4b, between the upper plate 1 and the lower plate 2 of the prosthesis is necessary. For example, this angle is between 0° and 15°. To adjust the angle required according to the patient, it is simply necessary to select a core 3 with a suitable angle between the mean plane representing its upper surface and the plane passing through its lower surface.

When the female components are located on the lower plates and the male components on the core, the lordotic core, in that it forms an acute angle in the front-rear direction, may then be integral with the plate by a projection entering a cavity or opening of the lower plate.

The inclination of the prostheses known in the prior art is obtained, either by the shape of the upper plate, when the core is flat, or by the position of the upper plate with respect to the core, when said core is convex. With respect to the first case of the prior art mentioned here, the machining of the prosthesis according to the present invention is more economical since the core is composed of a less expensive material (for example, polyethylene) than that composing the plates. With respect to the second case of the prior art mentioned here, the core of the present invention is not liable to be ejected outside the prosthesis since the angle between the plates is substantially constant when the prosthesis is in place.

If surgeons require a determined lordosis for one patient, they will select a core 3 allowing no clearance with respect to the lower plate 2. On the other hand, if they simply require the lordosis to remain within a range of values, they will select a core allowing a slight clearance in translation and rotation with respect to the lower plate 2.

The intervertebral disk prosthesis according to the invention may, in one alternative embodiment, represented in figures 7a, 7b, 8a and 8b, be anchored in the spinal column to prevent the prosthesis from migrating under the effect of the transversal resultant of the force exerted by the spinal column on the prosthesis in place, which increases with the lordosis. In this case, the lower plate 2 comprises one or more openings 28, 29 located in the vicinity of the rear side of the prosthesis, making it possible to receive anchoring means 4, 5.

In this way, in the case of figures 7a and 7b, the opening 28 of the lower plate 2 is rectangular and the anchoring means 4 is constituted of a body 40 and a head 41. The dimensions of the head 41 are slightly greater than those of the opening 28 of the lower plate 2, such that, once the anchoring means 4 are in place in a vertebra, the lower plate 2 is sandwiched between the head 41 of the anchoring means 4 and said vertebra. An angle, less than or equal to 90°, is comprised between the body 40 of the anchoring means 4 and the lower plate 2.

In the case of figures 8a and 8b, two circular openings 29 are comprised in the lower plate 2 and the anchoring means 5 are nail-shaped, with a head of greater dimensions than those of the openings 29 to make it possible to sandwich the lower plate 2 between the head of the anchoring means 5 and the vertebra whereon the prosthesis is anchored.

It should be clear to those skilled in art that the present invention enables embodiments in numerous other specific forms without deviating from the scope of the invention as claimed. Consequently, the present embodiments must be considered as illustrations, but may be modified in the field defined by the scope of the attached claims, and the invention must not be limited to the details given above.

claim.claim-text:
Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese, aufweisend zumindest drei Teile aufweisend eine erste Platte, die als die obere Platte (1) bezeichnet ist, eine zweite Platte, die als die untere Platte (2) bezeichnet ist, und einen Kern (3), wobei die obere konvexe Fläche des Kerns (3) mit zumindest einem Teil (10) der unteren konkaven Fläche der oberen Platte (1) im Kontakt ist und die untere Fläche des Kerns (3) im Kontakt mit zumindest einem Teil der oberen Fläche der unteren Platte (2) ist, wobei die obere Platte (1) zumindest im Bezug auf den Kern (3) bewegbar ist, wobei die Prothese Zusammenwirk-Mittel zwischen der unteren Platte (2) und dem Kern (3) aufweist, wobei die Zusammenwirk-Mittel Stecker-Mittel aufweisen, die mit Buchse-Mitteln zusammenwirken, um Translationsbewegungen des Kerns (3) im Bezug auf die untere Platte (2) entlang einer Achse, die im Wesentlichen parallel ist zu der unteren Platte (2), zu beschränken, und um Drehbewegungen des Kerns (3) im Bezug auf die untere Platte (2) um eine Achse, die im Wesentlichen rechtwinklig ist zu der unteren Platte (2), zu beschränken, wobei die Zusammenwirk-Mittel gerade Abschnitte, die entlang einer Vorne-Hinten-Richtung (F) der Prothese orientiert sind, und gerade Abschnitte, die rechtwinklig zu der Vorne-Hinten-Richtung orientiert sind, aufweisen, wobei die genannten geraden Abschnitte vermittelst gerundeter Abschnitte verbunden sind,
dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Zusammenwirk-Mittel sowohl des Kerns (3) als auch der unteren Platte (2) einander gegenüber in der Nähe von zwei Rändern der Prothese angeordnet sind, und die Abmessungen der Buchse-Mittel größer sind als die der Stecker-Mittel, um Bewegungen des Kerns (3) im Bezug auf die untere Platte (2) zu erlauben, wobei die geraden oder die gerundeten Abschnitte der Stecker-Zusammenwirk-Mittel mit den geraden oder den gerundeten Abschnitten der Buchse-Zusammenwirk-Mittel zusammenwirken, um die Bewegungen des Kerns (3) im Bezug auf die untere Platte (2) zu beschränken.
Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß Anspruch 1, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die untere Platte (2) Stecker-Mittel, die mit Buchse-Mitteln des Kerns (3) zusammenwirken, aufweist.
Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß Anspruch 1, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die untere Platte (2) Buchse-Mittel, die mit Stecken-Mitteln des Kerns (3) zusammenwirken, aufweist.

Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 3, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass ein Winkel zwischen der oberen (1) und der unteren (2) Platte dadurch erhalten wird, dass der Kern (3) einen spitzen Winkel in der Vorne-Hinten-Richtung (F) bildet.
Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 4, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass dieselben Platten (1,2) mit Kernen (3), die verschiedene Dicken haben, montiert werden können.
Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß einem der Ansprüche 4 oder 5, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass der Winkel zwischen der oberen (1) und der unteren (2) Platte zwischen 0° und 15° beträgt.

Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 6, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Stecker-Mittel zwei Zapfen (20) sind, die zu der Innenseite der Prothese hin gebogen sind, und dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Buchse-Mittel zwei Aussparungen (30) sind.

Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß Anspruch 7, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass zumindest einer der Zapfen (20) durch einen Sitz ersetzt ist, der mit einer Bohrung (200) ausgestattet ist, woran ein Vorsprung ist unter Benutzung eines Stifts, der in die Bohrung (200) eindringt.

Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 6, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Stecker-Mittel zwei Wälle sind, die einander gegenüber in der Nähe von zwei Rändern (21, 22) der Prothese angeordnet sind, und dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Buchse-Mittel Aussparungen sind.
Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 9, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass der Kern (3) aus Polymethylen hergestellt ist.

Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 10, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die untere Platte (2) in der Nähe der Vorderseite davon eine oder mehrere Öffnungen (28, 29) aufweist, die bereitgestellt sind, um Prothese-Verankern-Mittel (4, 5), die in einem Wirbel sind, aufzunehmen.

Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß Anspruch 11, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Öffnung (28) der unteren Platte (2) rechteckig ist, und dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Verankern-Mittel (4) aus einem Körper (40), der einen spitzen Winkel mit der unteren Platte (2) bildet, und einem Kopf (41) bestehen.

Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß Anspruch 11, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Öffnungen (29) der unteren Platte (2) kreisförmig sind, und dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die Verankern-Mittel (5) nagelförmig sind.

Intervertebral-Scheibe-Prothese gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 13, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass die obere Platte (1) zumindest in einem Teil der oberen Fläche davon konvex ist, um in die Form der Wirbel hinein zu passen.

Intervertebral disk prosthesis comprising at least three parts including a first plate, referred to as the upper plate (1), a second plate, referred to as the lower plate (2), and a core (3), the upper convex surface of the core (3) being in contact with at least part (10) of the lower concave surface of the upper plate (1) and the lower surface of the core (3) being in contact with at least part of the upper surface of the lower plate (2), the upper plate (1) being movable at least with respect to the core (3), said prosthesis comprising cooperation means between the lower plate (2) and the core (3), said cooperation means comprising male means cooperating with female means, so as to limit translation movements of the core (3) with respect to the lower plate (2) along an axis substantially parallel to the lower plate (2), and to limit rotation movements of the core (3) with respect to the lower plate (2), around an axis substantially perpendicular to the lower plate (2), said cooperation means comprising straight portions oriented along a front-rear direction (F) of the prosthesis and straight portions oriented perpendicular to said front-rear direction (F), said straight portions being connected by rounded portions, characterised in that said cooperation means of both the core (3) and the lower plate (2) are located opposite each other in the vicinity of two edges of the prosthesis, the dimensions of the female means being greater than those of the male means so as to allow movements of the core (3) with respect to the lower plate (2), said straight or rounded portions of the male cooperation means cooperating with said straight or rounded portions of the female cooperation means for limiting said movements of the core (3) with respect to the lower plate (2).
Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to claim 1, characterised in that the lower plate (2) comprises male means cooperating with female means of the core (3).
Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to claim 1, characterised in that the lower plate (2) comprises female means cooperating with male means of the core (3).

Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to any one of claims 1 to 3, characterised in that an angle between the upper (1) and lower (2) plates is obtained in that the core (3) forms an acute angle in the front-rear direction (F).
Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to any one of claims 1 to 4, characterised in that the same plates (1, 2) can be assembled with cores (3) of different thicknesses.
Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to any one of claims 4 or 5, characterised in that the angle between the upper (1) and lower (2) plates is between 0° and 15°.

Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to any one of claims 1 to 6, characterised in that the male means are two pins (20) curved towards the inside of the prosthesis, and in that the female means are two recesses (30).

Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to claim 7, characterised in that at least one of the pins (20) is replaced by a lug equipped with a drilling (200) whereon a tag (23) using a dowel (24) entering the drilling (200).

Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to any one of claims 1 to 6, characterised in that the male means are two walls located opposite each other in the vicinity of two edges (21, 22) of the prosthesis, and in that the female means are recesses.
Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to any one of claims 1 to 9, characterised in that the core (3) is made of polyethylene.

Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to any one of claims 1 to 10, characterised in that the lower plate (2) comprises one or more openings (28, 29) in the vicinity of its front side, provided to receive prosthesis anchoring means (4, 5) in a vertebra.

Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to claim 11, characterised in that the opening (28) of the lower plate (2) is rectangular, and in that the anchoring means (4) consist of a body (40), forming an acute angle with the lower plate (2), and a head (41).
Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to claim 11, characterised in that the openings (29) of the lower plate (2) are circular, and in that the anchoring means (5) are nail-shaped.

Intervertebral disk prosthesis according to any one of claims 1 to 13, characterised in that the upper plate (1) is convex on at least part of its upper surface to fit into the shape of the vertebrae.

Prothèse de disque intervertébral comprenant au moins trois parties comprenant un premier plateau désigné comme plateau supérieur (1), un second plateau désigné comme plateau inférieur (2) et un noyau (3), la surface convexe supérieure du noyau (3) étant en contact avec au moins une partie (10) de la surface concave inférieure du plateau supérieur (1) et la surface inférieure du noyau (3) étant en contact avec au moins une partie de la surface supérieure du plateau inférieur (2), le plateau supérieur (1) étant mobile au moins par rapport au noyau (3), ladite prothèse comprenant des moyens de coopération entre le plateau inférieur (2) et le noyau (3), lesdits moyens de coopération comprenant des moyens mâles coopérant avec des moyens femelles, afin de limiter des mouvements de translation du noyau (3) par rapport au plateau inférieur (2) le long d'un axe sensiblement parallèle au plateau inférieur (2), et afin de limiter des mouvements de rotation du noyau (3) par rapport au plateau inférieur (2), autour d'un axe sensiblement perpendiculaire au plateau inférieur (2), lesdits moyens de coopération comprenant des portions droites orientées le long d'une direction avant-arrière (F) de la prothèse et des portions droites orientées perpendiculairement à ladite direction avant-arrière (F), lesdites portions droites étant raccordées par des portions arrondies, caractérisée en ce que lesdits moyens de coopération, à la fois du noyau (3) et du plateau inférieur (2), sont positionnés à l'opposé les uns des autres à proximité des deux bords de la prothèse, les dimensions des moyens femelles étant supérieures à celles des moyens mâles afin de permettre des mouvements du noyau (3) par rapport au plateau inférieur (2), lesdites portions droites ou arrondies des moyens de coopération mâles coopérant avec lesdites portions droites ou arrondies des moyens de coopération femelles pour limiter lesdits mouvements du noyau (3) par rapport au plateau inférieur (2).
Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon la revendication 1, caractérisée en ce que le plateau inférieur (2) comprend des moyens mâles coopérant avec des moyens femelles du noyau (3).
Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon la revendication 1, caractérisée en ce que le plateau inférieur (2) comprend des moyens femelles coopérant avec des moyens mâles du noyau (3).

Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 3, caractérisée en ce qu'un angle entre les plateaux supérieur (1) et inférieur (2) est obtenu par le fait que le noyau (3) forme un angle aigu dans la direction avant-arrière (F).

Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 4, caractérisée en ce que les mêmes plateaux (1, 2) peuvent être assemblés avec des noyaux (3) de différentes épaisseurs.
Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon l'une quelconque des revendications 4 ou 5, caractérisée en ce que l'angle entre les plateaux supérieur (1) et inférieur (2) est compris entre 0° et 5°.

Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 6, caractérisée en ce que les moyens mâles sont deux ergots (20) recourbés vers l'intérieur de la prothèse, et en ce que les moyens femelles sont deux évidements (30).

Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon la revendication 7, caractérisée en ce qu'au moins l'un des ergots (20) est remplacé par un plot muni d'un perçage (200) sur lequel est fixée une patte (23) à l'aide d'une goupille (24) pénétrant dans le perçage (200).

Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 6, caractérisée en ce que les moyens mâles sont deux parois positionnées à l'opposé l'une de l'autre à proximité des deux bords (21, 22) de la prothèse, et en ce que les moyens femelles sont des évidements.
Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 9, caractérisée en ce que le noyau (3) est réalisé à partir de polyéthylène.

Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 10, caractérisée en ce que le plateau inférieur (2) comprend une ou plusieurs ouvertures (28, 29) à proximité de son côté avant, prévues pour recevoir des moyens d'ancrage de prothèse (4, 5) dans une vertèbre.

Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon la revendication 11, caractérisée en ce que l'ouverture (28) dans le plateau inférieur (2) est rectangulaire, et en ce que les moyens d'ancrage (4) se composent d'un corps (40) formant un angle aigu avec le plateau inférieur (2) et une tête (41).

Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon la revendication 11, caractérisée en ce que les ouvertures (29) du plateau inférieur (2) sont circulaires, et en ce que les moyens d'ancrage (5) sont en forme de clou.

Prothèse de disque intervertébral selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 13, caractérisée en ce que le plateau supérieur (1) est convexe sur au moins une partie de sa surface supérieure pour s'adapter à la forme des vertèbres.
